author: Claudio Sousa
column5: the store seems to be in extremely poor management. It‚Äôs hardly ever stocked on produce
column6: and what is there is often old. The seafood section is gross and often smells so terrible it fills that section of the store(they have dozens of king crab legs on display and they never seem to cycle them out)'

author: David
text: 'This store is a mess. It smells like rotting seafood as soon as you walk in and they are never stocked properly. Products are out of place or not stocked at all. Go to ShopRite if you can.'

author: Silly Loomis
text: "The most expensive deli I've ever been to in 40 years. The prices are 2x the price of a normal deli anywhere else.  Nobody should ever buy anything from this deli."

author: Julie Borelli
text: 'I like shopping at Acme\nthe prices are low\nbetter deals than shoprite'

author: sheena costen
text: 'I like this acme it has good sales for seniors and money orders and the workers treat me nice üôÇ'

author: Maggie Chretien
text: "Local store in Hoboken for people who don't drive. Has a nice selection for its size. The store is great on a hot day because it's nice and cold inside from all the refrigeration. Clean and well kept
column5: you'll find something for yourself without breaking the bank. Small parking lot  outside."

author: Julienne Pohl
text: 'Nice store. Clean and well stocked. Prices were very reasonable. Check out clerk was very courteous. I was very satisfied'

author: Pete
column5: less selection than ShopRite
column6: but usually has what I need for a quick grocery run.'

author: jlowell
text: 'So glad they finally put self-checkouts in this place! And the employee running them on Saturday mornings is super nice and friendly. The bakery has a huge selection. Better than most Acmes which is hard to believe considering how small of a space they have for the bakery.'

author: Mark
text: 'Medium sized store with limited assortment of fresh produce
column5: the personnel is friendly but when I bought ground meat
column6: it was looking pink and fresh outside but inside was old gray meat. suggest not to buy fresh meats there'

author: Diana Jin
column5: but consistently overpriced.\n\nIt has the basics in terms of produce
column6: but sometimes the shelves are wiped out and you have slim pickings until the staff can restock.\n\nIt's in a great location and probably thrives off of the foot traffic
column7: but otherwise it is quite overpriced and I would rather make a trip to ShopRite unless I needed one or two ingredients for something immediately."

author: Debi Oconnor
column5: your courtesy should explain your policy on buying cigarettes and self check out... Will not buy a thing from Acme in Hoboken üò†'

text: 'Nice store. Pretty decent selection. Always clean. Employees are friendly and helpful.'

author: Mario Torrado Ezquerra
text: 'I find everything I need. The staff is very helpful and nice.'

author: Dennis Aguilar
text: 'No papaya. Nice cashier. I would shop there again.'

author: Emily Raque
text: "This is a pretty standard grocery store with a variety of products
column5: though it is still an urban grocery store so it's not huge and doesn't have EVERYTHING. The star off is because I have been severely dissapointed with everything I've gotten from the seafood counter"

author: David Edwards
text: 'Been coming here for a year. It‚Äôs good for processed/dried foods
column5: but their produce is always bad. Most of it looks like it‚Äôs one day from spoiling. Puckering peppers
column6: brown Brussels sprouts
column7: etc. My husband says they have the worst bananas and won‚Äôt buy them anymore (how do you have bad bananas?) The apples have been fine. I thought the issue with the produce was seasonal but after a year I‚Äôm still underwhelmed. Go to the Aspen Marketplace for produce.'

author: Matt Garrison
text: 'Working at this store must be a tortuous experience for the employees. At no point will you find an employee who doesn‚Äôt look or act completely miserable to be there. You will find a lot of eye rolls when you have any questions or not a single second of acknowledgement when you say ‚Äúhave a good night‚Äù. Avoid this place like the plague and trek it down to Trader Joe‚Äôs where all products are a better quality and the people actually like working there.'

author: Tom Koty
text: 'Good store. Not much else to say. Customer service desk is sometimes more focused on themselves than the customers.'

author: Stacy Sing
text: "I went here yesterday and I was really surprised.  This was my first time shopping at this ACME.   It's really clean
column5: organized and the man at the front was really helpful.  He had the patience of a saint.  I keep changing my mind about my purchase and he didn't get annoyed at me.  I will do more shopping at ACME."

text: 'Do a lot of shopping in this store. Never disappoints.'

text: 'Despite the fact that this this is the place that Wille E Coyote buys all his  failed roadrunner hunting gadets I entered through the magic double doors wide eyed and bewildered by all of the sweet sweet backround jams of rod stewart juxtaposed againt oppressive neon signage hoovering over the most delectable and healthy looking produce i have ever seen. Hand to god.'

text: 'Not bad for Hoboken. But the storeacks some essentials.'

author: Samantha Colon
text: "On thursday morning may 14th me an a friend were on our morning break and decided to take a quick run to Acme not realizing the time and that it was Senior hours.... two employees one which I'm assuming was a manager was very rude in telling us we could not purchase anything because it was senior hours which is fine but there was a woman on line who was about the same age as me who said the woman in charge had let her slide because it was her son's birthday and she had to purchase a few things also I saw a few people in the supermarket shopping who happened to be around the same age as me mind you I'm 34. ...the thing that got me was the fact that i work in hoboken university medical center and it was clearly stated on my shirt!!!!!...I didnt expect any special treatment but honestly those two employees need to practice better people skills!!!"

author: Jeremy Lehrman
text: '5/12-5/14: Employees are NOT following rules for face coverings. Several were wearing masks around their neck
column5: below their chin.  One cashier had his mask in his hand (!)'

author: Zach Z
text: "Whats up with all the bad reviews? Definitely not as good as shoprite or trader joes in terms of selection and prices
column5: but when I have come here during the pandemic at non-peak hours
column6: it's been very empty and has become my go-to since shoprite started limiting its hours."

author: Justin Woo
text: 'My wife had band rehearsal in Hoboken. I drove her there. There was no parking anywhere. None. Zero. Nada. So I came to the Acme. I stood here for 45 minutes. I did my best not to look like a vagrant. I bought a protein bar because I was starving and the prepared food section was closed because it was 8pm on a Saturday. I suffered a minimum number of existential crises. The protein bar helped. I was not kicked out. 10/10 would Acme again.'

author: Jamie Krusewicz
text: 'Review Update: Not only has the selection deteriorated so I stand behind my review from years ago but today I called to get information on the price for a 6ft hero for a party. The woman on the phone told me I had to come in to fill out a paper. I told her I was not ready to order but simply inquiring the price. She continued to say I had to come in. I asked
column5: "Wait. You are really going to make me drive in to look at a piece of paper to find the price?" When I asked for her name she quickly said that she would have to "look for the information herself and she is busy" but did not give me her name. I was appalled to say the least.\n\nExisting Review: Poor selection. A&P was better.'

author: Claire Redfield
text: "I used to like to shop at Acme until they accused me of being a shoplifter. Sometimes I would go look around before I started work
column5: to see if there was anything I would purchase later. The afternoon manager
column6: I don't know his name
column7: but he resembled a run over chipmunk came over to me and in a very passive aggressive way accused me of being a shoplifter! I was so flabbergasted by such an accusation I didn't know how to react. They have security footage of me doing nothing but browsing.  I recommend don't shop there
column8: they act like their PAYING customers are criminals."

author: Philip Wild
text: "When ACME first took this location over
column5: I was not too pleased. Selection wasn't great and neither were the prices.  Over the past few months
column6: I have noticed a major change.  They run some really good sales.  The staff goes out of their way to be helpful. They know they need to compete and they have been rising to the occasion.  It's a solid alternative to Shoprite."
